Does the company account for and report on the overall Scopes 1, 2 and 3 emissions derived of and from its business in accordance with the Greenhouse Gas ('GHG') Protocol?
context: Scope 1: Direct GHG emissions which occur from sources that are owned or controlled by the company, for example, emissions from combustion in owned or controlled boilers, furnaces, vehicles, etc., emissions from chemical production in owned or controlled process equipment. Scope 2: Electricity indirect GHG emissions from the generation of purchased electricity consumed by the company, which physically occur at the facility where electricity is generated. Scope 3: All other indirect GHG emissions which occur in the value chain and as a consequence of the activities of the company, including both upstream and downstream emissions, which are not already included in Scope 2.

question: Please elaborate on the company's accounting for and reporting of Scope 1, 2 and 3 emissions in accordance with the GHG Protocol and/or send copies of the relevant documents to onboarding@bunker-holding.com.
answer: In the financial year 23/24, we calculated Bunker Holding’s second carbon accounts covering all material Scope 1, 2, and 3 emissions across our entire value chain. In calculating our carbon accounts, we follow the standards and guidance from the GHG Protocol.We include all relevant business activities in our carbon accounts. Scope 1 and 2 include the emissions from all activities, that we as a company have control over, whereas Scope 3 covers the emissions from our value chain. For the financial year 23/24, our total carbon footprint was 85,468,682 metric tonnes CO2e, of which more than 99% are related to fuel products, we sell to our customers. Performance overview FY22/23: Scope 1: 112,613 MT CO2e, Scope 2: 1,861 MT CO2e, Scope 3: 85,354,208 MT CO2e.

question: Does the company set annual goals to reduce emissions?
Please elaborate on the company's annual goals to reduce emissions and/or send copies of the relevant documents to onboarding@bunker-holding.com.
answer: For 2030, we have established new targets for the reduction of our Scope 3 emissions that taps into IMO's revised strategy:1. We commit to a reduction in carbon intensity of at least 4.5% and striving for an 8.5% reduction in emissions stemming from our fuel portfolio. 2. We have set a goal that supports scaling the availability of very low-carbon fuels. This involves working towards having very low-carbon fuels make up at least 5% of our total product portfolio. Climate impact from Own Activities:Physical operations (scope 1+2): We are committed to IMO’s target of reducing greenhouse gas emissions by 50% by 2050 compared to 2008. To achieve this target, we will use FY2022/23 to set a baseline for our reduction targets and develop a decarbonization roadmap.Service operations (scope 1+2 and business travel from scope 3):For emissions stemming from service operations, we commit ourselves to becoming net-zero emissions by 2040. To reach our net-zero emissions target, nature-based solutions will, by 2040, offset a limited portion of our emissions, in particular for the hard to abate emissions stemming from air travel.

question: Does the company have a health and safety management policy/procedures (or similar) in place?*
Please elaborate on the company's health and safety management policy/procedures (or similar) in place and/or send copies of the relevant documents to onboarding@bunker-holding.com.
answer: Health & Safety Policy: We have launched a unified Health and Safety Policy covering the working environment at all of our locations. The policy, which applies to all employees, is set to mitigate risks effectively as it’s continuously assessed for potential hazards, taking preventive actions to minimize the likelihood of incidents and the associated consequences.
